Sudan army chief slams Quad truce proposal as 'worst yet'
subhead: Sudan's army chief said that the proposal sent by the US envoy on behalf of mediators was the 'worst yet,' insisting that the only acceptable peace deal would include a total retreat of the RSF, who would be confined to specific areas.

title: Pope calls on kidnappers in Nigeria to free 265 students and teachers after some pupils escape
subhead: A total of 253 schoolchildren and 12 teachers are still being held by the kidnappers. Pope Leo XIV stated during mass on Sunday: 'I make a heartfelt appeal for the immediate release of the hostages and urge the competent authorities to take appropriate and timely decisions to ensure their release.'

title: Victor Hugo's interior architecture on display in Paris
subhead: The Maison de Victor Hugo on Place des Vosges unveils a lesser-known side of the writer's life with 'Hugo the decorator,' an exhibition that reveals the creativity he poured into designing his own homes.

title: 'I told him about my day in real time': The couples who can't stop texting on WhatsApp
subhead: While couples in France exchange an average of nine text messages a day, some go far beyond, updating their partner in real time about every event in their day-to-day lives. Is this constant connection a sign of profound intimacy, or a need for control?

title: The MAGA world, divided over Trump's politics and eaten away by neo-Nazi movement
subhead: The Epstein case, tech billionaires, Venezuela, Israel: The movement that brought Donald Trump back to the White House now finds itself splintered on numerous fronts.  An openly antisemitic, racist and misogynistic current is gaining ground around Nick Fuentes.

title: Ukraine's Pokrovsk faces fierce fighting, footage analyzed by Le Monde reveals
subhead: The major city in the Donbas faces the threat of falling after a slow encirclement by Russian forces. It would be a militarily costly victory, but one that could bolster Vladimir Putin's claims over the region.
